On 03/12/20 at 09:45 the river level was 0.12m.

We have had one day of steady but not torrential rain. How can the river rise 1.21 metres in that time? Yet again we have water in our pavilion as a result. VERY worrying. @EssexCCB @EnvAgencySE @LoughtonRA @eppingforestdc https://t.co/l91kbJDr7Y https://t.co/IRHkkS2sWI

text: @AllonewordMike @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency @WestBerkshire Hello Mike. We are looking at all enforcement options on the Lambourn case, prosecution is one. It’s a criminal investigation, so we can’t say too much right now, but it’s not about being unable to take action. Thanks for your concern about both incidents, which we share. Peter

@CraigBennett3 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts Glad to hear that there will be legal action taken - hopefully it will send a clear message to others who try to destroy the environment in the same way...
